Column Comment.0: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.1: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.4: STRING SOURCE: the source of data for the PROD STRING
Column Comment.5: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.6: PDEN PROD STRING CROSS REFERENCE SEQUENCE NUMBER: A seqeuncenumber added to allow ordering (by time) of cross references.
Column Comment.7: ALLOWABLE OBSERVATION NUMBER: a value which uniquely identifies uniqueinstances of allowables.
Column Comment.8: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.9: ALLOWABLE: The allowable production for the production string
Column Comment.10: ALLOWABLE DATE:; Date on which the allowable value was initiated.
Column Comment.11: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.14: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which the allowable came into effect.
Column Comment.15: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the allowable was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.16: PERIOD TYPE: A reference table identifying the length of time for which a volume isrecorded. Possible values are DAY, MONTH, YEAR.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: PRODUCT_TYPE: The product identified as a component for this table.
Column Comment.19: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
